danfulea.utils

Class PDFRenderer

  • java.lang.Object
    • danfulea.utils.PDFRenderer
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.AutoCloseable

    public class PDFRenderer
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.AutoCloseable
    Utility class for creating PDF file, mainly used for converting long string (which also populate, say, a JTextArea in main application) into a PDF.
    Author:
    Dan Fulea, 10 AUG. 2016

    • Method Detail

      • renderText

        public void renderText(java.lang.String Info)
                throws java.io.IOException
        Fill the PDF with the text supplied as argument. It uses by default Helvetica, size 12 font and all margins taken into account are of 1 cm. If text size is too large then it will be displayed only a part of it which fits in a row. It does not create new page!

        This is only useful to print small texts. USE THIS ONLY FOR TESTING.

        Parameters:
        Info - the String
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - can throw this exception

      • renderTextHavingNewLine

        public void renderTextHavingNewLine(java.lang.String Info)
                             throws java.io.IOException
        Fill the PDF with the text supplied as argument. It uses by default Helvetica, size 12 font and all margins taken into account are of 1 cm. The text is splitted into lines based on the presence of the new line character. It does not create a new page!!

        This is useful to print small texts having new-line characters ("\n") such those which also populate GUI components (e.g. JTextArea). USE THIS ONLY FOR TESTING.

        Parameters:
        Info - the String
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - can throw this exception

      • setTitle

        public void setTitle(java.lang.String title)
              throws java.io.IOException
        Sets the title on top of the page center aligned. If title is too large, then it is displayed on more lines not centered. It uses helvetica bold font of default size 12 and all margins taken into account are of 1 cm.
        Parameters:
        title - the title
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - can throw this exception

      • setSubTitle

        public void setSubTitle(java.lang.String subtitle)
                 throws java.io.IOException
        Sets the subtitle on top of the page below the title center aligned. If subtitle is too large, then it is displayed on more lines not centered. It uses helvetica bold font of default size 10 and all margins taken into account are of 1 cm.
        Parameters:
        subtitle - the subtitle
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - can throw this exception

      • getLines

        private java.util.List<java.lang.String> getLines(java.lang.String text,
                                                  float fontSize,
                                                  org.apache.pdfbox.pdmodel.font.PDFont pdfFont,
                                                  float width)
                                           throws java.io.IOException
        Get the lines arrays based on input text. If text doesn't fit the row, then it is split into lines using space (" ") character as splitter.
        Parameters:
        text - the text
        fontSize - text font size
        pdfFont - text font type
        width - the width limit to fit into
        Returns:
        the line array
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - can throw this exception

      • addPageNumber

        public void addPageNumber()
                   throws java.io.IOException
        Sets the page number on all pages center aligned. It uses helvetica bold font of size equal with regularFontSize and all margins taken into account are of 1 cm.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - can throw this exception

      • renderTextEnhanced

        public void renderTextEnhanced(java.lang.String text)
                        throws java.io.IOException
        Fill the PDF with the text supplied as argument. It uses by default COURIER, default font size of 7 (which can be changed via setRegularFontSize) and all margins taken into account are of 1 cm. The text is splitted into lines based on the presence of the new line character. It does create a new page if needed! Also if a line doesn't fit the page width, a new line is automatically created from last SPACE character.

        This is useful to print all kind of texts, for instance those texts which also populate GUI components (e.g. JTextArea).

        Note that the text must be trimmed and TAB-free in order to be successfully displayed (this is handled automatically by this routine). Otherwise, this version of PDFBox library complains about u0009 invalid font type when encounter TAB and TAB-like characters. This may affects texts which uses those characters, not a really big issue since they are still displayed reasonably well, but it is a known shortcoming for now. iText library performs better in this regard but it is GPL-ed, so I try to avoid any restrictive softwares (i.e. force to create only free software!).

        Parameters:
        text - the String
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - can throw this exception
